heading: Today
text: Any snow showers north ending.  Clouds giving way to sunshine south, north into the Champlain Valley.  Increasing afternoon sun in the northern mountains. Still blustery.  Morning highs in the 30s, falling through the 20s north, upper 20s south late. Northwest winds 10 to 15 mph, gusting to 30 mph, diminishing this afternoon.

heading: Tonight
text: Partly cloudy this evening, then clouds spreading east, with snow developing in NY late.  Lows in the teens, a few single numbers northeast, rising late.  Winds becoming light, turning to the south near 10 mph west of the Green Mountains after midnight.

heading: Tuesday
text: Snow spreading northeast, becoming moderate to heavy south of the Adirondacks and Rt. 2.  Accumulations 1 to 3 inches near and north of the Quebec border, 3 to 6 inches south to Rt. 4 and through the White Mountains, and 5 to 9 inches south. Highs in the 20s north to near 32 south.  Winds south to southeast near 10 mph, light in wind-sheltered valleys.
